content.description:
Stand start splayed with your right hand on a puddingstone pocket higher up on arete, your right foot on an edge of the 90-degree saw scar, and your left foot in a little space. Move your hands up onto a rail, reset, and top out up the slab.

 *** A few feet to the left, theÂ western corner has a funky overhang that a strong person could pull a route out of....
content.protection: It is short. A pad? A spotter?
content.location: It is on the southwest corner of The Cave Boulder atop the hill west-northwest of Pusherman Wall.

content.description: Climb out and up from the inside of the cave.
content.location: Start in the crawlspace in the cave.

content.description: The Cave is one of a pair of big lone boulders on the hilltop west-northwest of Pusherman Wall. The Cave is the northernmost of the two boulders and - surprise - contains a deep short cave on its northeastern side, while the western face has a couple of climbs on it. Its pair is the Cuba Boulder, located 15 yards to the south.
